TopicTitle: I enjoyed Scott Manley interview with you guys (ksp devs)

Articles.Content:
Was really cool

Good luck and keep it going strong.

Agreed, it was the most informative video in the list.

I am soooo glad they fixed the patched conics, one little single-precision number that messed it all up .
Yeah, funny enough that was my favorite of the various preview videos (though Danny's does come close... )

Yes.

Interviews like that are what I've wanted ever since I started following this game. I want more of you guys talking shop.
It was indeed most enjoyable.
full ack. was the best video of all yesterday.
10linksss?
Is there a transcript for this video? Some episodes is kinda hard for me to understand.
I did too. I've said it elsewhere, but I enjoy hearing the devs talk about building KSP almost as much as I enjoy playing it.

10linksss?

Its the first one in this group of videos.

Absolutely, it was really fun to watch and listen in on the inner workings of this game we all love. Most all of the mathematics was beyond my studies (or recollection) but who knew I might actually learn or be inspired to learn from a video game with green snack eating beings?

Adding my voice to the chorus, I really did enjoy a video of the game devs talking about the processes that they have gone through, the kinds of issues that they have had, the sorts of crazy bugs and issues they've encountered in programming, and how that ties back into creating a space simulation. I know next to nothing about programming, yet the discussion between Felipe, Chad, and Scott were excellent. I'd gladly watch another 40 minutes of discussion.
Sometimes Scott can seem a little arrogant, but love the videos from him, especially this one :-)

Yes, this was really great. I love hearing frank and casual discussions about the inner workings and how the code comes together. As a programmer, I followed along and it made perfect sense compared to observations within the game. It's making me even more excited for the update, because just the improvements in the precision and calculations alone will make it a great update!
Was a great video.
Indeed, It was fun seeing them talk about the under-the-hood problems with programming.
All I want to know is what's the semi-latus rectum of Uranus?

Sometimes Scott can seem a little arrogant, but love the videos from him, especially this one :-)

Meh scott is downright humble compared to some other internet personalities out there. I've found his videos most enjoyable both for entertainment value and on an intellectual basis. I always look forward to his videos because they are frequently very informative.

Yea. They keep us in the dark on many things, a major flaw of the media team IMO. Although I didn't really understand many of terms used, this is a great way to understand why everything takes so long: game making is really hard!
So I think I understand what the semilatus rectum is, but what is it used for? determining eccentricity?
Hi, it was in my subs list, but I cannot find it. Did Scott take the video down?
Hi, it was in my subs list, but I cannot find it. Did Scott take the video down?

So I think I understand what the semilatus rectum is, but what is it used for? determining eccentricity?

See the section on free orbits (a free orbit is just any stable orbit not requiring further energy input).

This is the sorta video is for the diehard KSP fans.

Not about all the dumb and fun stuff you can do with asteroids and the claw. But rather how the game mechanics have been fine tuned, and what sort of mathematical and programming challenges Squad has to fix to make the game better.

You may not exactly care what they did to make things better, but everyone will have to agree these changes are for the better.
That was a great video of "talking shop". Id love to see more of these.
